title: President’s Fund felicitates top A/L achievers with Rs. 30 mln in grants
byline: Three hundred students from the Northern Province who excelled in all subject streams of the 2023 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination will each receive a grant of Rs. 100,000 from the President’s Fund.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Sabaragamuwa province and in Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: World awaits Iranian response after US hits nuclear sites
byline: The world braced on Sunday for Iran’s response after the U.S. attacked key Iranian nuclear sites, joining Israel in the biggest Western military action against the Islamic Republic since its 1979 revolution.

title: Shooting incident reported in Akmeemana
byline: Two persons on a motorcycle have opened fire at a residence on Dissanayake Mawatha, Wewegodawatte, Akmeemana, Galle.

title: Sri Lankan film ‘Riverstone’ picks up two awards at Shanghai International Film Festival
byline: The 27th Shanghai International Film Festival (SIFF) celebrated the best in global cinema at a star-studded Golden Goblet Awards ceremony held at the iconic Shanghai Grand Theatre.

title: US issues ‘worldwide caution’ for Americans over Mideast conflict
byline: The US State Department issued a “worldwide caution” for Americans on Sunday, saying the conflict in the Middle East could put those traveling or living abroad at an increased security risk.

title: First celestial image unveiled from revolutionary telescope
byline: A powerful new telescope in Chile has released its first images, showing off its unprecedented ability to peer into the dark depths of the universe.

title: Jaffna to lead first phase of coconut pest eradication program
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board has announced the launch of a special program titled “Coconut Fortnight” (‘Pol Desathiya’) as an immediate measure to combat pests, particularly whiteflies, which pose a significant threat to coconut cultivation.

title: UN Security Council meets on Iran as Russia, China push for a ceasefire
byline: The U.N. Security Council met on Sunday to discuss U.S. strikes on Iran’s nuclear sites as Russia, China and Pakistan proposed the 15-member body adopt a resolution calling for an immediate and unconditional ceasefire in the Middle East.

title: Suspect arrested with smuggled cigarettes at BIA
byline: An individual has been arrested at the arrival terminal of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for smuggling a total of 5,000 sticks of foreign-made cigarettes (23 cartons).

title: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka today (23).

title: Suicide bombing at Damascus church kills 22, Syrian authorities say
byline: At least 22 people have been killed and 63 others wounded in a suicide bomb attack at a church in Damascus, Syria’s health ministry has said.

title: Tesla rolls out robotaxis in Texas test
byline: Tesla deployed a small group of self-driving taxis picking up paying passengers on Sunday in Austin, Texas, with CEO Elon Musk announcing the “robotaxi launch” and social-media influencers posting videos of their first rides.

title: Teachers’ unions warn of trade union action over salary delays
byline: The All Ceylon United Teachers’ Union has announced that it will resort to trade union action if the salaries of teachers in national schools for the month of June are not received by 12 noon today (23).

title: Satellite images indicate severe damage to Fordow, but doubts remain
byline: Commercial satellite imagery indicates the U.S. attack on Iran’s Fordow nuclear plant severely damaged - and possibly destroyed - the deeply-buried site and the uranium-enriching centrifuges it housed, but there was no confirmation, experts said on Sunday.

title: Pakistan condemns Trump for bombing Iran a day after recommending him for Nobel Peace Prize
byline: Pakistan condemned U.S. President Donald Trump for bombing Iran, less than 24 hours after saying he deserved a Nobel Peace Prize for defusing a recent crisis with India.

title: NPP secures power in Matale Municipal Council
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) today (23) succeeded in taking power in the Matale Municipal Council.

title: All prison chiefs summoned to Colombo for special discussion
byline: A special meeting has been held in Colombo today (23), after summoning all heads of prisons from across the country.

title: Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma appointed new Finance Secretary
byline: Former Deputy Minister Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma has officially been appointed as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: “Victory and defeat must be met with equal grace” - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya emphasized that the goal of participating in sports should not be solely about victory, but the values of unity and the positive attributes that we can receive from the sports.

title: SJB member elected Mayor of Hambantota Municipal Council
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has established power in the Hambantota Municipal Council, where the opposition held a majority in the previous local government election, and secured the post of Mayor today (23).

title: Sri Lanka grants clearance to FAO research vessel
byline: The government has granted clearance to a research vessel of Food and Agriculture Organization scheduled to commence research engagements in Sri Lankan in August.

title: Nissanka Senadhipathi arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: The Chairman of the Avant Garde Maritime Services Company, Nissanka Senadhipathi has appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today (23), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka calls upon all parties to de-escalate tensions in the Middle East
byline: Sri Lanka has called upon all parties to take concrete steps to de-escalate the situation in the Middle East region, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Over 16,000 kg of narcotics seized in raids under new govt – Acting IGP
byline: Since the incumbent government assumed power on 29 September 2024, police raids have resulted in the seizure of significant quantities of narcotics, according to Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP).

title: Iran’s supreme leader asks Putin to do more after US strikes
byline: Iran’s supreme leader sent his foreign minister to Moscow on Monday to ask President Vladimir Putin for more help from Russia after the biggest U.S. military action against the Islamic Republic since the 1979 revolution over the weekend.

title: No Sri Lankan casualties reported in Israel in past 24 hours – Embassy
byline: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel has confirmed that no Sri Lankan casualties have been reported in the past 24 hours as a result of the ongoing military conflict.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation climbs in May
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has increased to 0.6% in May 2025, compared to -0.8% in April 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Arrest warrant issued against ex–MP Sajin Vass
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (23) issued a warrant for the arrest of former Parliamentarian Sajin Vass Gunawardena, who failed to appear before the court in connection with a case filed by the Inland Revenue Commissioner regarding alleged income tax evasion amounting to nearly Rs. 36.9 million.

title: Superintendent of Anuradhapura Prison granted bail
byline: The Superintendent of the Anuradhapura Prison, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and subsequently remanded over allegations of unlawfully releasing an inmate of the Anuradhapura Prison under the presidential pardon for Vesak Poya, has been has been granted bail.

title: Stay order issued on inaugural session of Wanathawilluwa PS
byline: The Appeal Court today (23) issued an interim order preventing the holding of the inaugural session of the Wanathawilluwa Pradeshiya Sabha, which was scheduled to be held tomorrow (24), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: CPC prepares for any possible fuel crisis amidst Middle East tensions
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) says it is planning to take necessary measures if any possible fuel crisis arises in the future due to the ongoing conflict and escalating tensions in the Middle East.

title: UN Human Rights Chief arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk has arrived in Sri Lanka a short while ago, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: ‘We will end this war’: Iran issues warning to Trump
byline: Iran said on Monday that the U.S. attack on its nuclear sites expanded the range of legitimate targets for its armed forces and called U.S. President Donald Trump a “gambler” for joining Israel’s military campaign against the Islamic Republic.

title: ‘Sathosa’ case against Johnston Fernando adjourned till July 30
byline: The case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption against former Minister Johnston Fernando and three others was taken up for hearing once again before the Colombo High Court today (23).

title: Iran’s exiled ‘crown prince’ says he is ready to take over from Ayatollah Khamenei
byline: The exiled son of Iran’s last shah today offered himself up as interim leader to take over running the country as it transitions away from dictatorship.

title: U.S. must be punished, Iran President says: Report
byline: The United States must be punished for the weekend attacks on nuclear facilities, Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian told French President Emmanuel Macron, according to Iran’s Tasnim News Agency.

title: US Embassy’s special request to nonimmigrant visa applicants
byline: The United States Embassy in Colombo has requested all individuals applying for a F, M, or J nonimmigrant visa to change the privacy settings on all of their social media accounts to public, effective immediately.

title: Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma assumes duties as new Finance Secretary
byline: Dr. Harsha Suriyaaratchi has assumed duties as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.

title: Public urged to avoid misusing 119 emergency hotline
byline: Sri Lanka Police has issued a public appeal requesting all citizens to refrain from misusing the 119 emergency hotline.

title: Qatar condemns Iranian attack on air base and says it reserves right to respond
byline: Qatar has condemned Iran for attacking the US’ Al Udeid Air Base, calling it “a flagrant violation of Qatar’s sovereignty and airspace.”

title: Iran fires missiles at US Base in Qatar, explosions heard over Doha
byline: (UPDATED) Iran’s military said on Monday it had carried out a “devastating and powerful” missile attack on the Al Udeid U.S. airbase in Qatar, after explosions were heard across the Qatari capital following Tehran’s threat to retaliate for U.S. airstrikes.

title: US and UK tell citizens in Qatar to shelter in place
byline: The US and the UK have told their citizens in Qatar to shelter in place “until further notice”.

title: Court orders police to submit progress report in Kotahena schoolgirl suicide case
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (23) ordered police to submit a report on the progress of the investigation by July 7 regarding a complaint filed against a teacher suspected of sexually abusing a schoolgirl in Kotahena.

title: Fire breaks out in a shop in Kadawatha
byline: A fire has broken out in a shop located in Kadawatha.

title: Qatar shuts down airspace temporarily amid regional crisis
byline: Qatar said it has shut down airspace temporarily as part of measures taken amid developments in the region, a statement by the Qatari foreign ministry said on X.

title: Deshabandu denies involvement in Weligama hotel shooting, claims allegations politically motivated
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon today stated that he had no reason to be involved in the shooting at the W15 Hotel in Weligama, Matara and claimed that all allegations against him are politically motivated.
